definition[0]: to move quickly with short steps, especially because you are afraid and do not want to be noticed
example[0]: A little lizard scuttled across the path.
definition[1]: to ruin or end someone’s plans or chance of being successful – used especially in news reports
example[1]: The incident threatens to scuttle the peace process.
definition[2]: to sink a ship by making holes in the bottom, especially in order to prevent it being used by an enemy
